apiOperation.shortdesc: Converts degrees to radians.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the number of degrees converted to radians.

apiParam.apiDesc: the number of degrees to be converted.
the number of decimal places.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Converts degrees to radians.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.MathUtil;
MathUtil.degreesToRadians(null) // 0 MathUtil.degreesToRadians(0) // 0 MathUtil.degreesToRadians(1) // 0.017453292519943295 MathUtil.degreesToRadians(1, 0) // 0 MathUtil.degreesToRadians(1, 1) // 0 MathUtil.degreesToRadians(1, 2) // 0.02 MathUtil.degreesToRadians(1, 3) // 0.017 MathUtil.degreesToRadians(1.5) // 0.02617993877991494 MathUtil.degreesToRadians(30) // 0.5235987755982988 MathUtil.degreesToRadians(-8) // -0.13962634015954636

apiOperation.shortdesc: Converts milliseconds to seconds.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the number of milliseconds converted to seconds.

apiParam.apiDesc: the number of milliseconds to be converted.
the number of decimal places.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Converts milliseconds to seconds.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.MathUtil;
MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(null) // 0 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(0) // 0 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(1) // 0 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(300) // 0 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(300, 1) // 0.3 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(500) // 1 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(500, 1) // 0.5 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(1000) // 1 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(1000, 1) // 1 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(1500) // 2 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(1500, 1) // 1.5 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(1500, 2) // 1.5 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(2123) // 2 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(2123, 1) // 2.1 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(2123, 2) // 2.12 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(-2123) // -2 MathUtil.millisecondsToSeconds(-2123, 1) // -2.1

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the number that corresponds to the percentage in a given range.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the number that corresponds to the percentage in the range.

apiParam.apiDesc: the percent to be used in the range.
the begin of the range.
the end of the range.
determines whether the number should be rounded.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the number that corresponds to the percentage in a given range.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.MathUtil;
MathUtil.percentToRange(50, 0, 100) // 50 MathUtil.percentToRange(50, 100, 200) // 150 MathUtil.percentToRange(1, 26, 77) // 26.51 MathUtil.percentToRange(33, 26, 77) // 42.83 MathUtil.percentToRange(33, 26, 77, NumericRounding.FLOOR) // 42

apiOperation.shortdesc: Converts radians to degrees.

the number of decimal places.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Converts radians to degrees.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.MathUtil;
MathUtil.radiansToDegrees(null) // 0 MathUtil.radiansToDegrees(0) // 0 MathUtil.radiansToDegrees(1) // 57.29577951308232 MathUtil.radiansToDegrees(1, 0) // 57 MathUtil.radiansToDegrees(1, 1) // 57.3 MathUtil.radiansToDegrees(1, 2) // 57.3 MathUtil.radiansToDegrees(1, 3) // 57.296 MathUtil.radiansToDegrees(1.5) // 85.94366926962348 MathUtil.radiansToDegrees(30) // 1718.8733853924698 MathUtil.radiansToDegrees(-8) // -458.3662361046586

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the percentage corresponding to the number in a given range.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the percentage that corresponds to the number in the range.

apiParam.apiDesc: the number to be used in the range.
the begin of the range.
the end of the range.
determines whether the number should be rounded.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the percentage corresponding to the number in a given range.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.MathUtil;
MathUtil.rangeToPercent(50, 0, 100) // 50 MathUtil.rangeToPercent(50, 100, 200) // -50 MathUtil.rangeToPercent(150, 100, 200) // 50 MathUtil.rangeToPercent(27, 26, 77) // 1.9607843137254901 MathUtil.rangeToPercent(33, 26, 77) // 13.725490196078432 MathUtil.rangeToPercent(33, 26, 77, NumericRounding.FLOOR) // 13 MathUtil.rangeToPercent(51.5, 26, 77) // 50

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A utility class to work with objects that implement org.as3coreaddendum.system.IEquatable.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: NumberUtil is a static class and shouldn't be instantiated.

apiException.apiDesc: NumberUtil is a static class and shouldn't be instantiated.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: NumberUtil is a static class and shouldn't be instantiated.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks if objects are equal.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the value is NaN (not a number) and false otherwise.

apiParam.apiDesc: a Number object to evaluate.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Checks if objects are equal.
First thi method compare objects using o1 == o2. If it returns true then the method returns true. Otherwise it will be checked if both objects implement org.as3coreaddendum.system.IEquatable interface and then use o1.equals(o2).

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A utility class for working with random numbers.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: A utility class for working with random numbers.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: RandomUtil is a static class and shouldn't be instantiated.

apiException.apiDesc: RandomUtil is a static class and shouldn't be instantiated.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: RandomUtil is a static class and shouldn't be instantiated.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns an array of random numbers that can be repeated.

apiException.apiDesc: if the length argument is less than zero.

apiReturn.apiDesc: an array of random numbers that can be repeated.

apiParam.apiDesc: the begin of the range.
the end of the range.
the length of the array, must be greater than zero.
the number of decimal places.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns an array of random numbers that can be repeated.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.RandomUtil;
RandomUtil.randomArray(0, 10, 5) // [7,5,3,3,9] RandomUtil.randomArray(0, 10, 5, 1) // [5.6,4.6,8.7,3.5,0.9] RandomUtil.randomArray(10, 20, 5) // [16,10,15,16,16] RandomUtil.randomArray(-10, 10, 5) // [-7,-4,-10,7,-3] RandomUtil.randomArray(-7, 4, 5) // [-2,-7,2,2,3] RandomUtil.randomArray(-7, 4, 5, 2) // [-4.88,-4.98,3.38,-0.3,2.41] RandomUtil.randomArray(-20, -10, 5) // [-15,-14,-18,-13,-15] RandomUtil.randomArray(-1000, 1000, 5, 2) // [146.31,-839.97,-85.05,-525.63,-739.22]

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a random number between a range.

apiException.apiDesc: if the max argument is less than the min argument.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a random number between the range (min, max).

apiParam.apiDesc: the begin of the range.
the end of the range.
the number of decimal places.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns a random number between a range.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.RandomUtil;
RandomUtil.random(0, 10) // 3 RandomUtil.random(0, 10) // 0 RandomUtil.random(0, 10) // 10 RandomUtil.random(0, 10, 1) // 0.9 RandomUtil.random(0, 10, 1) // 9.6 RandomUtil.random(0, 10, 1) // 5.4 RandomUtil.random(0, 10, 2) // 2.87 RandomUtil.random(0, 10, 3) // 4.602 RandomUtil.random(-13, 11, 1) // -9.8 RandomUtil.random(-13, 11, 1) // -12.9 RandomUtil.random(-13, 11, 1) // 10.6 RandomUtil.random(-1000, 1000, 1) // 273.6 RandomUtil.random(-1000, 1000, 1) // -847.2 RandomUtil.random(-20, -10) // -15

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A utility class to work with String objects.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
A utility class to work with String objects.
StringUtil handles null input Strings quietly. That is to say that a null input will return null. Where a Boolean or int is being returned details vary by method.
Some terms used by this class related to String handling:
empty: a zero-length String ("")
space: the space character (" ", char 32)
blank: a String object only with control chars (space, \t, \n, \s)

apiConstructor.shortdesc: StringUtil is a static class and shouldn't be instantiated.

apiException.apiDesc: StringUtil is a static class and shouldn't be instantiated.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: StringUtil is a static class and shouldn't be instantiated.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Abbreviates a String object using ellipses.

apiException.apiDesc: If the maxWidth argument is less than 4.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the abbreviated String object. If the str argument is null then the return is null.

apiParam.apiDesc: the String object to check. May be null.
maximum length of the result String object, must be at least 4.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Abbreviates a String object using ellipses.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.StringUtil;
StringUtil.abbreviate(null , 4) // null StringUtil.abbreviate("" , 4) // StringUtil.abbreviate(" " , 4) // StringUtil.abbreviate("a" , 4) // a StringUtil.abbreviate("ab" , 4) // ab StringUtil.abbreviate("abcdefghij" , 4) // a... StringUtil.abbreviate("abcdefghij" , 5) // ab... StringUtil.abbreviate(" abcdefghij" , 5) // a... StringUtil.abbreviate("a bcdefghij" , 5) // a... StringUtil.abbreviate(" a bcdefghij", 5) // a... StringUtil.abbreviate("abcdefghij" , 6) // abc... StringUtil.abbreviate(" abcdefghij" , 6) // ab... StringUtil.abbreviate("a bcdefghij" , 6) // a b... StringUtil.abbreviate(" a bcdefghij", 6) // a... StringUtil.abbreviate("abcdefghij" , 7) // abcd... StringUtil.abbreviate("abcdefghij" , 8) // abcde... StringUtil.abbreviate("abcdefghij" , 9) // abcdef... StringUtil.abbreviate("abcdefghij" , 10) // abcdefghij StringUtil.abbreviate("abcdefghij" , 11) // abcdefghij StringUtil.abbreviate("abcdefghij" , 12) // abcdefghij

apiOperation.shortdesc: Capitalizes a String object, changing only the first letter to uppercase.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the capitalized String. If the str argument is null then the return is null.

apiParam.apiDesc: the String object to capitalize. May be null.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Capitalizes a String object, changing only the first letter to uppercase.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.StringUtil;
StringUtil.capitalize(null) // null StringUtil.capitalize(" ") // StringUtil.capitalize("a") // A StringUtil.capitalize("A") // A StringUtil.capitalize("ab") // Ab StringUtil.capitalize("Ab") // Ab StringUtil.capitalize("aB") // AB StringUtil.capitalize("AB") // AB StringUtil.capitalize("abc") // Abc StringUtil.capitalize(" abc") // abc StringUtil.capitalize(" Abc") // Abc

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks if the String object contains any character in the given set of characters.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the String object contains any of the chars of the search String object, false if not. If the str or search argument is null then the return is false.

apiParam.apiDesc: the String object to check. May be null.
the chars to find. May be null.
indicates whether case sensitivity is considered or not in the comparison.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks if the String object contains any character in the given set of characters.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.StringUtil;
StringUtil.containsAny(null , null) // false StringUtil.containsAny("abc", "") // false StringUtil.containsAny("abc", "a") // true StringUtil.containsAny("b" , "abc") // true StringUtil.containsAny("A" , "abc") // false StringUtil.containsAny("A" , "abc", false) // true StringUtil.containsAny("a" , "ABC") // false StringUtil.containsAny("a" , "ABC", false) // true

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks if the String object does not contain any of the characters of the given set of characters.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the String object does not contains any of the chars of the invalidChars String object, false if does. If the str or invalidChars argument is null then the return is true.

apiParam.apiDesc: the String object to check. May be null.
the invalid chars. May be null.
indicates whether case sensitivity is considered or not in the comparison.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks if the String object does not contain any of the characters of the given set of characters.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.StringUtil;
StringUtil.containsNone(null , null) // true StringUtil.containsNone("abc" , "") // true StringUtil.containsNone("abc", "a") // false StringUtil.containsNone("b" , "abc") // false StringUtil.containsNone("A" , "abc") // true StringUtil.containsNone("A" , "abc", false) // false StringUtil.containsNone("a" , "ABC") // true StringUtil.containsNone("a" , "ABC", false) // false

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks if the String object contains only characters in the given set of characters.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the String object contains only characters that exist in the validChars argument, false if contains any other characters. If the str or validChars argument is null then the return is false.

apiParam.apiDesc: the String object to check. May be null.
the valid chars. May be null.
indicates whether case sensitivity is considered or not in the comparison.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks if the String object contains only characters in the given set of characters.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.StringUtil;
StringUtil.containsOnly(null , null) // false StringUtil.containsOnly("abc", "") // false StringUtil.containsOnly("abc", "a") // false StringUtil.containsOnly("abc", "b") // false StringUtil.containsOnly("b" , "abc") // true StringUtil.containsOnly("ba" , "abc") // true StringUtil.containsOnly("A" , "abc") // false StringUtil.containsOnly("A" , "abc", false) // true StringUtil.containsOnly("a" , "ABC") // false StringUtil.containsOnly("a" , "ABC", false) // true

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks if the String object contains the specified search String object.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the String object contains the search String object, false if not. If the str or search argument is null then the return is null.

apiParam.apiDesc: the String object to check. May be null.
the String object to find. May be null.
indicates whether case sensitivity is considered or not in the comparison.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks if the String object contains the specified search String object.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.StringUtil;
StringUtil.contains(null , null) // false StringUtil.contains(null , "") // false StringUtil.contains("" , null) // false StringUtil.contains(" " , " ") // true StringUtil.contains(" " , "") // true StringUtil.contains("" , " ") // false StringUtil.contains("abc", "") // true StringUtil.contains("" , "abc") // false StringUtil.contains("abc", "a") // true StringUtil.contains("abc", "A") // false StringUtil.contains("abc", "A", false) // true StringUtil.contains("Abc", "a") // false StringUtil.contains("Abc", "a", false) // true StringUtil.contains("abc", "á") // false StringUtil.contains("ábc", "a") // false StringUtil.contains("ábc", "á") // true StringUtil.contains("a" , "abc") // false

apiOperation.shortdesc: Counts how many times the substring appears in the String object.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the number of occurrences or 0 if either argument is null.

apiParam.apiDesc: the String object to check. May be null.
the substring to count. May be null.
indicates whether case sensitivity is considered or not in the comparison.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Counts how many times the substring appears in the String object.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.StringUtil;
StringUtil.countMatches(null , null) // 0 StringUtil.countMatches("abc" , "") // 0 StringUtil.countMatches("abc" , "a") // 1 StringUtil.countMatches("abc" , "á") // 0 StringUtil.countMatches("ábca" , "á") // 1 StringUtil.countMatches("abc" , "b") // 1 StringUtil.countMatches("a" , "abc") // 0 StringUtil.countMatches("abc" , "aa") // 0 StringUtil.countMatches("abca" , "a") // 2 StringUtil.countMatches("abca" , "aa") // 0 StringUtil.countMatches("aabca", "aa") // 1 StringUtil.countMatches("abc" , "ba") // 0 StringUtil.countMatches("abc" , "A") // 0 StringUtil.countMatches("abc" , "A", false) // 1 StringUtil.countMatches("abca" , "A", false) // 2

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns either the passed in String object, or if the String object is empty ("") or null, the value of defaultStr.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the defaultStr argument if the str argument is empty ("") or null, or the str argument otherwise.

apiParam.apiDesc: the String object to check. May be null.
the default String object to return if the str argument is empty ("") or null. May be null.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns either the passed in String object, or if the String object is empty ("") or null, the value of defaultStr.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.StringUtil;
StringUtil.defaultIfEmpty(null , null) // null StringUtil.defaultIfEmpty("" , null) // null StringUtil.defaultIfEmpty(null , "abc") // abc StringUtil.defaultIfEmpty("abc" , "") // abc StringUtil.defaultIfEmpty("abc" , null) // abc StringUtil.defaultIfEmpty(" " , "abc") // abc StringUtil.defaultIfEmpty(" \n\t ", "abc") // abc

apiOperation.shortdesc: Check if the String object ends with a specified suffix.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the String object ends with the suffix or if both arguments are null.

apiParam.apiDesc: the String object to check. May be null.
the suffix to find. May be null.
indicates whether case sensitivity is considered or not in the comparison.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Check if the String object ends with a specified suffix.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.StringUtil;
StringUtil.endsWith(null , null) // true StringUtil.endsWith("" , null) // false StringUtil.endsWith(null , "abc") // false StringUtil.endsWith("abcdef", "f") // true StringUtil.endsWith("abcdef", "F") // false StringUtil.endsWith("abcdef", "F", false) // true StringUtil.endsWith("abcdEF", "eF") // false StringUtil.endsWith("abcdEF", "eF", false) // true StringUtil.endsWith("abcdef", "ef") // true StringUtil.endsWith("abcdef", "abcdef") // true StringUtil.endsWith("abcdef", "abcdefg") // false

apiOperation.shortdesc: Compares two String objects, returning true if they are equal.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the String objects are equal or both are null.

apiParam.apiDesc: the first String object. May be null.
the second String object. May be null.
indicates whether case sensitivity is considered or not in the comparison.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Compares two String objects, returning true if they are equal.
Two null references are considered to be equal.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the first char of the String object.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the first char of the String object. If the str argument is null then the return is null.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the first char of the String object.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.StringUtil;
StringUtil.firstChar(null) // null StringUtil.firstChar("") // StringUtil.firstChar(" ") // StringUtil.firstChar("a") // a StringUtil.firstChar("ab") // a StringUtil.firstChar("abc") // a StringUtil.firstChar(" abc") // StringUtil.firstChar(" abc ") //

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks if the String object contains only lowercase characters.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks if the String object contains only lowercase characters.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.StringUtil;
StringUtil.isAllLowerCase(null) // false StringUtil.isAllLowerCase("") // false StringUtil.isAllLowerCase(" ") // false StringUtil.isAllLowerCase(" \t ") // false StringUtil.isAllLowerCase("abc") // true StringUtil.isAllLowerCase("Abc") // false StringUtil.isAllLowerCase("ABC") // false StringUtil.isAllLowerCase("óbc") // true StringUtil.isAllLowerCase("Óbc") // false StringUtil.isAllLowerCase("ÓBC") // false

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks if the String object contains only unicode letters, digits or spaces.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A utility class to work with Array objects.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
A utility class to work with Array objects.
ArrayUtil handles null input arrays quietly in almost all methods. When not, it's documented in the method. That is to say that a null input will not thrown an error in almost all methods.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks whether two arrays are the same length, treating null arrays as length 0.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if length of arrays matches, treating null as an empty array.

apiParam.apiDesc: the first array. May be null.
the second array. May be null.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Checks whether two arrays are the same length, treating null arrays as length 0.
Two null references are considered to be equal.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.ArrayUtil;
ArrayUtil.isSameLength(null, null) // true ArrayUtil.isSameLength(null, []) // true ArrayUtil.isSameLength([], []) // true ArrayUtil.isSameLength([1], [2]) // true ArrayUtil.isSameLength([1, "a"], [2]) // false ArrayUtil.isSameLength([1, "a"], [2, "b"]) // true

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the index position of the largest number in the array.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the index position of the largest number in the array. If the array argument is null or empty then the return is -1.

apiParam.apiDesc: the array to check. May be null.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the index position of the largest number in the array.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the largest number in the array.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the largest number in the array. If the array argument is null or empty then the return is NaN.

apiParam.apiDesc: the array to check. May be null.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the largest number in the array.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns an empty array for a null input array.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the same array or an empty array if null input.

apiParam.apiDesc: the array to check for null or empty.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns an empty array for a null input array.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3coreaddendum.utils.ArrayUtil;
ArrayUtil.nullToEmpty(null) // [] ArrayUtil.nullToEmpty([]) // [] ArrayUtil.nullToEmpty([1]) // [1] ArrayUtil.nullToEmpty(["abc", 123]) // [abc,123]

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sorts the array of objects alphabetically through the object's property.

the name of the property to be recovered and compared between the objects.

Sorts the array of objects alphabetically through the object's property.
This method uses the org.as3coreaddendum.system.comparators.AlphabeticalComparator and org.as3coreaddendum.system.comparators.PropertyComparator objects together.
This method modifies the original array.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Swaps the position of all elements in the array according to newPositions.

apiParam.apiDesc: the array to swap the position of all elements.
the array with the new positions.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Swaps the position of all elements in the array according to newPositions.
array[0] will be equal array[ newPositions[0] ]
array[1] will be equal array[ newPositions[1] ]
and so on...
The length of both arrays must be equal.
This method modifies the original array.
